Krhinos: If you mean you're actually better at processing the ore
rather than mining it out, that's fine by me. Anyways, that drill we
brought with us is specially made to fit on one of my multi-purpose
pod. Just engage that energy link so we can travel back and forth.
Rukus, set us on orbit right over the link once Dracon engages it.
We'll be good to go right after that.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
> Dracon had already had the basics of the camp set up.
> 
> "I'm on it Captain, you boys just sit tight," he assures them.
> 
> Meanwhile, Dracon continues to work diligently at getting things in
order, staying focused and concentrating on the task at hand.  The
"structure" of the camp location was up, and now Dracon was simply
putting equipment into place.  He carries a couple of advanced radars
and such and places them on a table.  When everything seemed ready to
roll, he got back to his comrades.
> 
> "Captain, I believe everything's just dandy over here, and we are
just about ready to get to work and finally accomplish the operation
that will revolutionize our company," he says before asking, "tell me
Captain, shall I operate from the camp while you do your thing?  I
mean, I'm much better on the sidelines than working with the
heavy-duty stuff."
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Nic 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Monday, June 23, 2003 9:21 AM
>   Subject: Re: StarDrill Inc.
> 
> 
>   Krhinos: Get in orbit. As soon as Dracon's finished building the base
>   camp, we'll start the actual dig. Dracon, get moving! Find a nice
>   place with lots of mining space and start building! Tell us when
>   you're done so we can link an energy bridge between the station and
>   the camp.
> 
>   The huge tank-bot was excited with the perspective of mining on Earth.
>   It was more than a dream, more like finally touching the stuff of
>   legends. Perhaps he would even dig the Ark up. Now what would he do
>   with that?
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
>   > --Rukus--
>   > 
>   > The transwarp engines hum as they come out of warped space into 
>   > normal time. They had arrived at the destination planet it record 
>   > time... but of course, their ship was top of the line and not many 
>   > could catch them once they were really moving.
>   > 
>   > "Right on schedule boss, we've just arrived at the planet and come 
>   > out of warped space. Awaiting your orders?" said Rukus as he 
>   > finished his status report.
>   > 
>   > 
>   > --------------------------------------------
>   > Krhinos: Good! Set out as soon as I give the word. I don't think 
>   > it'll
>   > be long yet.
>   > 
>   > The station came out of the warp just above Earth. The perfect
>   > opportunity!
>   > 
>   > Krhinos: Hey Rukus! We there yet?
>   > --------------------------------------------
